intro: Ligusticum scothicum var. hultenii, commonly known as the Hulten's lovage, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, spicy scent when crushed. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences compared to other members of the Ligusticum genus.
